body.p: The change bars are used to mark some revised elements in content. They are useful for example in technical documentation to flag added content in a new version of the file.

Suppose you have the following document:

Once every 6000 kilometers or three months, you need to change the oil in your car. It will extend your car lifetime.This should be done by a specialist in a controlled environment.
section.note:
The change bars can be customized using 5 properties:
-oxy-changebar-offset Defines the distance between the text and the change bar
-oxy-changebar-placement Defines the position of the change bar
-oxy-changebar-style Defines the appearance of the change bar
-oxy-changebar-color Defines the change bar color
-oxy-changebar-width Define the change bar width

All the -oxy-changebar CSS properties support the attr(), oxy_xpath() and calc() functions.

section.note: In case you don't want to create new elements to mark change bars starting and ending point, you can use the display property on both ::before and ::after pseudo elements (NB you can also use ::changebar).
